text: anyone know if it’s possible to temporarily disable browsers from using local fonts
(testing font loading and it’d just come in handy)
on a mac i've disabled fonts via fontbook before for testing
lol, Shoptalk Show - “legacy code should be called _*legendary*_ code” because as much as it’s getting cob webs, you haven’t had to change it, it’s been working just fine up until now.
Love it, developers are really good about bashing legendary code ignoring the fact that they have very little insight into what was known to the developer when it was originally written.

Anyone know if its possible in HS reporting to grab a list where you can see the views of a url and then drill down to see the contacts who have viewed that page? Looks like you can't filter the "Activity" of page view in the custom reports tool :disappointed:

we used this method to see which contacts viewed key pages:
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Reporting-Analytics/Viewing-who-has-viewed-my-web-page/td-p/202677>
Awesome, thank you Lindsey, much appeciated
If I remember correctly though, the Page View criteria ignores any UTM parameters. So, for example, you wouldn't be able to see if someone viewed your about page and came from a specific source
Not sure if you're even trying to do that but I remember running into that issue when using Page View
I am going to look into the <https://www.stitchdata.com> solution, anyone use this before with HS? or is anyone from Stitch in this slack?
I have a json object - this object has HTML code inside of it. I want to output the entire json object as just plain text, I don’t want the HTML coming out as actual html
stringify alone does not seem to solve this, do I encodeURI it?
nope encodeURI is wrong. anyone got any ideas?
okay looks like i might have figured it out
